active_learning.discussion_prompt: Evaluate the trade-offs of enforcing OEM Secure Boot keys versus implementing custom keys in an enterprise setting. When might one approach be preferable (e.g., simplicity vs. control), and what are the risks (e.g., key compromise, revocation issues)? Use case studies like a bootkit/rootkit attack to debate, addressing misconceptions such as 'Secure Boot stops all malware' (it only prevents boot-time threats).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Secure Boot Enablement (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Asset Provisioning > Asset Acquisition and Onboarding > Hardware Provisioning and Setup > Secure Boot Enablement). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and research context (complete truncated parts: Trusted Boot = Windows feature for boot integrity attestation working with Secure Boot; ELAM = Early Launch Anti-Malware service that loads before other drivers to detect malware) to create high-quality, spaced-repetition optimized flashcards. Incorporate university pedagogy: Align cards to Bloom's levels, scaffold from foundation to integration, embed active learning hooks (e.g., questions prompting discussion/troubleshooting). Research best practices: UEFI keys (PK/KEK/db/dbx), pitfalls (unsigned bootloaders, key lockout), platforms (Windows/Linux/shim), integration (TPM/BitLocker), compliance (NIST/CMMC). Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, each strictly following this schema: {front: "...", back: "...", explanation: "...", bloom_level: "REMEMBER|UNDERSTAND|APPLY|ANALYZE|EVALUATE|CREATE", scaffolding_layer: "1|2|3|4", distractors: ["opt1", "opt2", "opt3"] } (omit distractors for non-MCQ). Generate 50 flashcards ensuring even coverage: Prioritize voter priorities (pedagogy, completeness, scaffolding). Make fronts engaging/active (e.g., 'Why might you choose custom keys? Evaluate...'). Explanations correct misconceptions and link to big picture (asset lifecycle security).
